messages.subject: For all newer members (was TCS, the modern view?)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/4/02 2:24:53 PM, lizanderrol@cox.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/4/02 2:24:53 PM, lizanderrol@... writes:

<< I have no problem with being reasonble I assumed that we were
talking about after being reasonable had been tried. >>

There seems an implication that some of us aren't reasonable.

Or that the writer is reasonable, but reason ends past those actions
(whatever they might be).

Please be careful not to insult people who've been unschooling happily for
many years when you answer routine questions here. Even if the old timers
blow it by, others reading here won't know who's new to unschooling and who's
more experienced, and having successful practices misrepresented for the sake
of an argument doesn't really do anyone much good.

Thanks.

Sandra
